question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/secp256r1_ecdsa/secp256r1_ecdsa_keys.rs] [Attack: Memory Dump] If a validator node is compromised and memory is dumped, how long do private keys remain in memory after use, and can they be extracted from core dumps or swap files? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/secp256r1_ecdsa/secp256r1_ecdsa_keys.rs] [Attack: Supply Chain] If a malicious version of the p256 crate is injected through supply chain attacks, what guarantees exist that key generation and signing operations haven't been backdoored? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/secp256r1_ecdsa/secp256r1_ecdsa_keys.rs] [Attack: Type Confusion] Can an attacker craft Move smart contracts that confuse PrivateKey and PublicKey types through unsafe deserialization, breaking the type safety guarantees? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/secp256r1_ecdsa/secp256r1_ecdsa_keys.rs] [Attack: Downgrade Attack] Can an attacker force validators to accept secp256r1 signatures when ed25519 is required, or vice versa, breaking authentication assumptions for specific transaction types? (High)
